840180408:
[

Senior Manager, Omni-Channel Marketing

Company Name adidas Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 373 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Please note applicants must have legal rights to work in Australia. No Relocation or Visa support is offered for this role.

_______________________________________________________________________

Senior Manager, Omni-Channel Marketing

At the adidas Group, our love of sport drives who we are and what we do. But just as a ball is more than leather and thread, and a shoe more than padding and plastic, we are bigger than our products. We don’t just work to create faster shoes and lighter fabrics: We strive to help athletes everywhere perform their best. We believe that it’s hard work inventing the future of sport, and that’s why we love it; that when you push your limits, you make it possible for others to push theirs.

Purpose & Overall Relevance For The Organisation

Due to an overseas internal promotion, an opportunity exists to join the adidas Brand team as Senior Manager, Omni-Channel Marketing reporting to the Director, Brand adidas. Based at our Pacific (Australia & NZ) HQ in Mulgrave this role is responsible for ensuring positive development of adidas’ Brand image across Sports Performance and Sports Style Omni Channel (retail, franchise, wholesale, ecom) touchpoints. The role will be responsible for executing across all categories, in order to support sustainable and profitable market share growth in the Pacific through all channels. In addition, the role is responsible for maximizing the profitability of all channels by positively impacting Traffic, Conversion, ATV, UPT and Profit Margin across all store formats through flawlessly executed consumer-relevant CRM, marketing campaigns, promotions and in-store communication.

Key Responsibilities

Strategy & Priorities
  • Develop Omni-Channel Marketing strategies aligned to established business strategies such as Key City, Customer and Category Strategic plans by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders
  • Develop Go-to-Market (GTM) sell in and sell out strategies across seasonal priorities by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders

Seasonal Omni-Channel Marketing Calendar Planning
  • Define and own the development of the yearly Omni-Channel Marketing Calendar across Sports Performance and Originals (and Neo) for each channel. This Calendar includes Campaigns, store openings, fit-outs / remodels and other activations.
  • Development of the Calendar will be aligned to channel and category sell out targets across Campaigns and other market-related activity.
  • Ensure the flawless execution of Sports Performance, Originals (and NEO) Omni-Channel Marketing Campaigns, Projects, Promotions and In-Store Communication tools.
  • Ensure each Campaign and/or Project is effectively planned, delivered and evaluated against targets, ensuring that budgets (MWB and SWB) are optimized.
  • Development of reporting for each Campaign and/or Project both for internal, external and SEAPAC stakeholders, in order to drive continuous improvement.

Business Metrics
  • Develop a deep understanding of the targets and performance of each channel, understanding which Omni-Chanel Marketing levers need to be activated to impact which KPIs and the understanding of how to activate them as needed.
  • Work closely and cross-functionally with the channel teams to pro-actively assess performance issues (such as persistently declining traffic or a particularly slow month) and develop the tactical Omni-Channel Marketing solutions in order to address with the Channels.
  • Whilst not prescriptive examples of KPIs, include Traffic, Conversion, ATV, UPT, Net Sales and Profit Margin.

Team Management
  • Promote a high-performance culture by setting clear expectations and individual goals.
  • Evaluate the competencies of team members on a regular basis and provide prompt feedback and guidance to drive high performance.
  • Take ownership of Talent Management processes to grow, develop and retain talent.
  • Translate the company goals into team-specific actions and business plans. Control and monitor performance and results.


Other
  • Identify optimal local Omni-Channel Marketing agency partners in order to negotiate, secure and appoint long-term partnerships in order to deliver high standard Campaign executions.
  • Own and manage market Mono and Multi Marketing Activation budget, ensuring projects come in within budget and MWB is optimized.


Key Relationships
  • Market Brand Activation teams.
  • Market Category and Channel teams.
  • Market Omni Channel Marketing agencies and vendors.
  • SEAPAC Omni Channel Marketing.


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Advanced user of MS Office.
  • Solid business acumen and in-depth knowledge of Retail KPIs.
  • Highly numerate with the ability to understand and analyze data and produce actionable insights.
  • Solid interpersonal, networking and negotiating skills.
  • Strong leadership, problem-solving and decision-making abilities.


Requisite Education & Experience / Minimum Qualifications
  • University degree in business, ideally with marketing and sales focus or equivalent professional experience.
  • 8-10 years Retail/Trade or Marketing experience (minimum 3 – 4 years Retail experience is essential)
  • 3 - 5 years management experience.

What’s on offer?

A competitive base salary, bonus scheme and adidas employee benefits are also on offer to the successful candidate

How do I apply?
  • Press the "Apply" button and follow the instructions
  • You will be required to fill out the online applications forms, and attach a copy of your resume and cover letter which addresses all above candidate requirements
  • Applications which do not attach a cover letter which addresses the job requirements specific to adidas will not be considered.
  • Applications will only be accepted through the steps above
  • Please note that due to the high volume of applications adidas receives, we will be unable to respond to all individual inquiries.

________________________________________________________________________________

About Adidas

adidas Group Jobs http://careers.adidas-group.com/

Linkedin http://bit.ly/futureofsport

Facebook http://www.facebook.com/futuretalents

________________________________________________________________________________

Note to agencies: adidas Pacific does not accept any unsolicited calls or resumes from head hunters, executive recruiters, or other staffing or recruitment agencies. Please do not submit or forward any resumes, CVs or profiles to the adidas careers portal, nor to any adidas personnel. adidas will not pay any fees relating to unsolicited resumes.

Project Engineer MIMA

Company Name Service Stream Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 88 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Details
The Role

Service Stream's network construction operations team are seeking a Project Engineer to project manage telecommunications network construction projects on behalf of our client, nbn. The Project Engineer will have full end to end responsibility from project planning through to practical completion for a program of SAMs (Service Area Modules). Based from Service Stream's Clayton South office, this position will report to the Project Manager, and is offered on a full-time, permanent basis. Motor vehicle, laptop and mobile phone are included in the package as the role is both office and field based.

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead and deliver a program of SAMs in accordance with client requirements
  • Manage the development of the SAM Project Management Plan detailing delivery strategy, budget, program, materials management, risks and responsible personnel
  • Select, assign and manage subcontractors during construction, monitoring and improving on productivity metrics
  • Manage program profit and loss to ensure the program meets budget
  • Ensure robust quality assurance processes are followed and that completed SAMs meet client quality requirements in addition to legislative OH&S, environmental and regulatory requirements
  • Lead the variation process via approved delegation channels


Required Skills & Experience

To be successful in this position, you will have solid experience in construction management from within the fixed telecommunications sector. You will have experience in managing a program budget, following a variation process and managing subcontractors from procurement through to payment. In addition to your experience, you will be able to demonstrate strength in the following competencies:
  • Planning and project management skills
  • Problem solving
  • Ability to communicate with a diverse range of stakeholders
  • Commercial and financial acumen

Working with Service Stream

Benefits And Rewards Offered To Our Employees Include

Service Stream is an ASX listed company who specialise in the end-to-end delivery of the high volume services required to construct, maintain and upgrade Australia's essential communications, energy and water networks. At Service Stream we're all about taking pride in your own contribution and respecting the contribution of others. We share responsibility for getting the job done right, and recognise opportunities for new or better ways to make things work together, wherever they arise.
  • Annual leave purchasing
  • Employee share scheme
  • Refer a Friend bonus
  • Talent & Succession Program

Manager - Retail Resource Planning

Company Name Red Energy Company Location 570 Church St, Cremorne Victoria

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 68 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

It's exciting times here at Red Energy - 100% Australian owned, over 1200 employees and consolidation with Lumo Energy - this is a success story we're proud of. When we first entered the energy market in 2004 - we wanted to provide something different, to shake things up and we've been doing a good job of it ever since. We have moved into our stunning purpose designed office in East Richmond which is an open plan, activity based, collaborative environment that needs to be seen to be believed. You’ll want to work here.


An opportunity has become available for a Manager - Retail Resource Planning to come in and lead this fast paced, high touch function. The role reports to the General Manager - Customer Management and supports a number of key customer focused business units across the whole retail business comprising of Red Energy and Lumo Energy. In addition to your resource planning expertise and people leadership experience, you’ll be a natural at building and managing stakeholder relationships that deliver favourable commercial terms and service levels to meet the needs of the Retail business.


The role will see you manage the forecasting and resource planning for an onshore and offshore model that both share the same aim of continuing to deliver award winning customer service to our over one million customers. You understand that delivering in your role directly impacts one of our key business differentiators - an exceptional customer experience. You also understand that your internal customers will rely on you to become a part of their team that they can't do without.


You’ll probably be known amongst your peers as a statistics and reporting pro and nothing data related stumps you. We will be relying on the successful individual to provide meaningful reporting to the business and use data to make recommendations for improvement. \xa0


Finally, we are looking for a strong people leader that understands an engaged team is a productive team. We’re values led and empower our people leaders to foster a team of engaged high performers that truly care and want their team and the wider business to continue to flourish.


If you feel you have what it takes, then we encourage your application.

Clinical Manager/Lead Speech Pathologist

Company Name Barwon Health Company Location Geelong, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Lead a well-staffed and strong clinical team to excellence
  • Thrive professionally in providing your expertise and leadership to Speech Pathology Services
  • Enhance your career at Victoria’s leading regional health care service


About The Facility

The Barwon Health Speech Pathology service provides Acute Care (University Hospital Geelong), Rehabilitation and Subacute Care (McKellar Centre) and Community and Mental Health services for the Barwon South West Region.

The Speech Pathology department provides services to a wide range of clinical areas to clients with swallowing and communication disorders. Speech Pathology is predominantly inpatient focused with some outpatient services provided in head and neck, voice and paediatrics. A strict criterion exists for outpatient and paediatric services.

About The Role

Are you ready to take on the challenge of a leadership role? Barwon Health is seeking a dedicated Speech Pathology Manager to lead and enhance our contemporary, safe and effective Speech Pathology service.

Duties of your role include but are not limited to:
  • Provide effective and efficient clinical services that are high quality, safe and evidence based to meet the needs of the clients.
  • Understand, develop and implement a strategic approach to address issues which impact on professional practice and business operations.
  • Lead and manage strategic, operational and workforce planning activities
  • Monitor and manage the financial performance of the budget and adjust to meet Barwon Health operational requirements and annual targets.
  • Facilitate and support staff undertaking research activities to build the research culture

As an Allied Health leader you will also be expected to:
  • Represent Allied Health on relevant committees or forums
  • Take portfolio responsibility for areas of work/service delivery
  • At all times you will be expected to lead and be governed by the values of Barwon Health.


About The Culture

Join an organisation that recognises talent, develops leaders and values their staff. Enjoy the rewards, benefits and feel proud that you can be a key strategic partner to improving outcomes for Barwon Health, our staff, patients and the community.

Barwon Health Staff Benefits
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Professional development
  • Access to employee wellness facility
  • Salary packaging
  • Social club
  • Centrally located at University Hospital, only minutes from the vibrant waterfront
  • Our Commitment to Child Safety
  • Be our future Barwon Health Strategic Plan
  • Aboriginal Employment Plan

At Barwon Health we celebrate and harness diversity, and consider it a competitive advantage. We encourage applications from all diverse backgrounds including individuals that identify as Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, GLBTIQ+, and individuals with a disability. Our organisation promotes the safety, wellbeing and inclusion of all our consumers including children and appropriate rigorous reference and background checks will be undertaken. Barwon Health is proud to be Totally Smoke Free.

Recruitment agencies should note that Barwon Health does not accept agency resumes. Barwon Health is not responsible for any fees related to any unsolicited resumes submitted by Recruitment Agencies.

Mid-Senior level

  • Health, Wellness and Fitness

Job description

THE FUTURE’S WHAT YOU MAKE IT.

WE WILL HELP YOU MAKE IT BRILLIANT.

\xa0

Build the Future is our successful long-term international graduate program.

We are Prysmian Group, the world's leading designer and manufacturer of cables. With manufacturing facilities in over 50 countries, progress is the driving force of our business.

We use cutting-edge technology to make the leap from imagination to reality.

\xa0

Our people don’t just react to today, they shape the future.

This is your chance to be one of them: build your talent!

\xa0

Join us and you will have:

• permanent contract with highly competitive salary;

• induction training in our HQ delivered in partnership with a Top school of Management;

• job rotation in R&D, Operations and Sales;

• warm up period in your home country for the upcoming international assignment role;

• two years of International Assignment within a multicultural environment;

• technical or junior managerial appointment after your two years of experience;

• mentorship program.

\xa0

Just imagine the possibilities….

Do you see cables, or opportunity?

\xa0

We're searching for graduates keen to pursue a business management or technical career.

To apply for the program, you'll need a Degree in one of the following fields:

  • Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Information Technology or be currently working towards one;

  • Business Administration, Economics or Finance or be currently working towards one.

\xa0

We also expect you to:

  • have had an outstanding university career, with experience abroad;

  • have graduated not more than 18 months ago;

  • be able to speak fluent English (a second language is preferential title)

  • be willing and ready to live overseas for 2 years, experiencing new cultures and work environments;

  • demonstrate strong communication skills and interpersonal skills.

\xa0

If you think you've got what it takes to succeed in this highly-challenging, yet rewarding environment, apply via our website and start using all your energy and knowledge to help shape the future of the world.

\xa0

Full Time
Fixed Term 12 months
Senior Officer

About Us

The City of Whittlesea is one of the fastest growing municipalities in Australia. As a Council, we offer over 100 services to our public. Our workforce is diverse, with a wide range of nationalities, age groups, backgrounds and skills that enrich the workplace.

At the City of Whittlesea we value diversity and appreciate everyone’s strengths. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects our municipality. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, people from culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, people with a disability and people identifying as LGBTIQ. The City of Whittlesea is also a Child Safe employer.

The Role
As an organisation, we have been focussed on providing our communities with services, infrastructure and strategic planning which is critically needed to support the third fastest growing municipality in Victoria. 10,000 additional people choose to make Whittlesea their home every year. Thus as an organisation, we have been focused in meeting this ever-increasing demand and we want to do this in a way that provides the best customer experience.

The role is pivotal in galvanising and harvesting the opportunities for the City of Whittlesea to provide to the community the best possible services and will look at points of leverage across the whole service value chain for the Council.

The role will further oversee coordination and customer assurance activities, including planning and implementation coordination as required, and will ensure consistent tracking of customer benefits realisation across all products and offerings developed for the portfolio in alignment with overall organisational objectives.

Want to know more?
The full Position Description is available on the careers at Council page at Liana Thompson, Acting Chief Executive Officer on 9217 2205.

To apply for this position, you must address the Key Selection Criteria outline in the Position Description.

Please note all applicants must apply online and no late applications will be accepted.
